projects.title: AVRYai AI Receptionist Platform
projects.description: B2B SaaS voice AI receptionist platform for inbound call handling, scheduling, and messaging workflows.
evidence: Repository structure includes `api/`, `voice-gateway/`, and `web/` services.
Backend entrypoint exists at `api/main.py` with supporting `api/routers/`, `api/services/`, and `api/migrations/`.
Voice orchestration entrypoint exists at `voice-gateway/server.js`.
Deployment artifacts include `Dockerfile.api`, `Dockerfile.voice`, and `docker-compose.prod.yml`.
Deployment scripts exist (`deploy-api.sh`, `deploy-voice.sh`) for separate service rollouts.
what_i_built: Split call handling into separate API and voice gateway services.
Integrated telephony, scheduling, and messaging workflows in backend services.
Added deploy scripts and container definitions for cloud deployment.
Maintained both customer-facing web and service-level backend code in the same system.
hard_problems: Coordinating real-time call events and asynchronous backend state changes.
Handling reliability across multiple third-party APIs in one call flow.
Keeping deployable service boundaries while features continue to evolve.
how_to_run: Configure required provider credentials in local `.env` files before startup.

projects.title: Betty Sports Betting Research Platform
projects.description: Real-time data aggregation and scoring system for researching market opportunities.
evidence: Repository contains `src/connectors/`, `src/scoring/`, `src/models/`, and `tests/`.
Scoring implementation is present in `src/scoring/engine.py` with configurable weights.
Local stack artifacts include `docker-compose.yml` and `Dockerfile`.
Dependencies include FastAPI, Redis, SQLAlchemy, websockets, pandas, and numpy.
`scripts/init-db.sql` exists for database initialization.
what_i_built: Built ingestion paths for websocket and REST data sources.
Implemented a weighted scoring engine with factor modules.
Set up persistence models and async database access patterns.
Containerized local development setup for repeatable bootstrapping.
hard_problems: Normalizing mixed market feeds into a single scoring pipeline.
Balancing score freshness with database write volume.
Keeping connector failures isolated from overall system operation.
how_to_run: Run app with `python -m src.main --dev` after installing requirements.
Set API credentials in `.env` for enabled connectors.

projects.title: Chatty Multi-Interface LLM Client
projects.description: Monorepo chat platform with web, API, and CLI interfaces.
evidence: Monorepo workspace includes `apps/web`, `apps/api`, and `apps/cli`.
API server entrypoint is `apps/api/src/index.ts` with Prisma migration scripts in package config.
`docker-compose.yml` provisions local Postgres for development.
`apps/web/tests` and Playwright config exist for end-to-end tests.
CLI package exposes a `chatty` binary via `apps/cli/package.json`.
what_i_built: Implemented API, web UI, and CLI interfaces in one workspace.
Added conversation history and export endpoints in API.
Wired Prisma-based schema and migrations for local data storage.
Set up developer scripts for multi-service local startup.
hard_problems: Keeping behavior aligned across web and terminal interfaces.
Managing monorepo build tooling across TypeScript services.
Handling schema changes without breaking local developer setup.
how_to_run: Run API migrations with `pnpm --filter @chatty/api prisma migrate dev`.
Run combined web + API dev workflow using `pnpm dev` from repo root.

projects.title: AVRYai Sales Copilot
projects.description: Real-time call assistant that transcribes and suggests next responses during live conversations.
evidence: Repository has distinct `backend/`, `frontend/`, and desktop shell directories.
Backend service entrypoint exists at `backend/main.py`.
Frontend overlay components exist in `frontend/src/App.jsx` and `frontend/src/Copilot.jsx`.
Desktop packaging is configured under `avryai-copilot-tauri/src-tauri/`.
Start scripts are present (`run.sh`, `start.sh`) for local iteration.
what_i_built: Implemented streaming backend for transcript and suggestion messaging.
Built frontend overlay for in-call response guidance.
Integrated desktop wrapper path for local operator workflows.
Documented multi-process local startup in README.
hard_problems: Managing low-latency transcript-to-suggestion flow in real time.
Maintaining conversation context quality across rapid speaker turns.
Coordinating backend, UI, and desktop shell during local development.
how_to_run: Desktop shell can be started from the Tauri workspace when needed.

projects.title: Beary Trading Dashboard
projects.description: Trading command center with real-time monitoring, charts, order book views, and analytics panels.
evidence: Dashboard code is split into `dashboard/backend/` and `dashboard/frontend/`.
Backend app entrypoint exists at `dashboard/backend/app/main.py`.
`dashboard/docker-compose.yml` defines containerized local services.
Frontend Vite app exists under `dashboard/frontend/src/`.
Project includes backtest and analysis directories used for research workflows.
what_i_built: Shipped backend API and frontend dashboard as separate deployable units.
Integrated websocket-enabled market data views in dashboard flows.
Added Docker-based local environment for service orchestration.
Maintained parallel research/backtest paths while evolving dashboard architecture.
hard_problems: Keeping UI stable under high-frequency data updates.
Supporting both operational dashboards and research pipelines in one codebase.
Refactoring system boundaries without blocking ongoing feature work.
how_to_run: Use `docker compose --profile full up --build` for full local stack.

projects.title: AVRYai Admin Dashboard
projects.description: Operational dashboard for authentication, conversation management, and lead monitoring.
evidence: Dashboard pages are implemented under `avryai-admin/src/pages/`.
Data and auth integration layers exist under `avryai-admin/src/services/` and `src/contexts/`.
Build tooling includes `vite.config.js`, `tailwind.config.js`, and production `dist/` output.
Routing and UI components are split across `src/components/` and page-level modules.
README documents local dev and production build commands.
what_i_built: Built authenticated admin flows for operational users.
Implemented conversation and detail pages for SMS management.
Added service-layer data access and periodic refresh behavior.
Maintained responsive UI patterns for desktop and mobile contexts.
hard_problems: Keeping operational tables usable as dataset size grows.
Balancing refresh cadence with API load and UI responsiveness.
Evolving auth/session handling while features are still being added.
how_to_run: Install dependencies with `npm install` in the app directory.
Run local dev server via `npm run dev`.
Create production build via `npm run build` and verify with `npm run preview`.
